item.description:
Welcome to the Third Annual Beaver Brook Winter Hike

Saturday, March 23  - Hollis, NH

Plunk and I have not been to Beaver Brook in quite a while and we remember it as a lovely area with numerous trails and beautiful scenery. And the smells there are pretty good too (this coming from a Beagle of course).

Okay well we did skip a couple of years for some reason.  Oooops.   We did a winter meetup here in 2008 and the 2nd annual was in December 2009.   But what's a couple of missed years among friends,  right ?   Or is that 14 years in doggie lives ???

Anyhooooooo....so let's get back to this as an annual event.

We hope you will join us for what promises to be a lovely afternoon in a truly scenic area. Hunting is not allowed on the property, however it is still advisable to wear orange in case any hunters disregard the posted signs. It never hurts to be on the cautious side. Please dress in layers, wear hat and gloves, bring water for you and your dog (snacks couldn't hurt either) and don't forget your pooper bags. You should also bring a leash .....just in case.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Here is a link to the Beaver Brook Association if you would like to learn more about them. You can also print out trail maps on their site: http://www.beaverbrook.org/

Once on their site click on Visit us in the upper left corner to find the trail maps.

Carpooling:

If anyone wants to carpool, we can meet at 10:00 am, in the Parking Lot at Bob's Dept Store on South River Road in Bedford NH.   If you are coming from Manchester or thereabouts, take the Kilton Road Exit  off of Route 101 W.  Go to the parking area in front of Bob's Store closest to the road)

Here's the address if you want to use GPS:

Bob's Store, 75 South River Road, Bedford, NH 03110 at the Bedford Mall Shopping Center

 

Here are driving directions from the files section of our meetup site:

Beaver Brook 117 Ridge Road Hollis, NH 03049

Take Exit 6 (off of Rte 3), then turn right onto Broad Street/Route 130.

Drive approximately 6 miles.

Once you get in to the "main town" of Hollis, but while you are still on Route 130, you will pass Lull Farms on your left, then Brookdale Farm also on your left.

At the fork in the road just past Brookdale Farm, bear right and travel approx one block, passing the Harvest Market shopping center on your right, to the set of lights. There's a bank building with a Dunkin Donuts on that corner, and a little café across the street with a chicken on the sign.

Continue with the following directions from the Beaver Brook web site:

Travel to the set of lights in Hollis (there is only one set of lights in Hollis).

Turn left at the lights; you will be on Route 122 South.

Drive approximately 1 mile and turn right onto Ridge Road.

Drive approximately 1 more mile. Maple Hill Farm will be on your right (117 Ridge Road).

You will see a large gray farmhouse with a barn attached to it.

The Beaver Brook office is in this building.

So everyone is covered by the liability waiver any guest you want to bring should sign up as a member to come on the hike. Minors would need a waiver signed by a parent/guardian.

As a condition of attending this meetup you agree to release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, and/or death, including those caused by negligence and or other reasons. You also agree to assume all risk associated with this meetup and agree to know and follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com.
item.how_to_find_us: Plunk will be the cute beagle screaming......Over Here......Over Here.......Over Heeeeeere !!!

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Beaver Brook in March
